42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Daniel Radcliffe turns 18 and gains access to £20 million fortune.
He plans to be frugal with his money, buying items under £10.
Radcliffe will mark his birthday with a party, but details are under wraps.
He aims to avoid the "kid star goes off the rails" stereotype.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Miami's "forgotten floor" houses mentally ill inmates awaiting trial.
Inmates face avoidable felonies, often due to confrontations with police.
Judge Steven Leifman advocates for justice and mental health reform.
New mental health facility aims to provide long-term treatment, not punishment.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Drivers describe harrowing tales of survival after Minneapolis bridge collapse.

Whole bridge gave way, fell into Mississippi River, with cars in water and on fire.

Survivors, including a doctor, helped rescue 55 people in under two hours.

Rescuers, including untrained bystanders, risked their lives to save others.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88:
President Bush had five small polyps removed from his colon on Saturday.
The polyps were less than a centimeter in diameter and not considered worrisome.
Bush is in good humor and will resume activities at Camp David.
Results from microscopic examination are expected in two to three days.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a:
NFL suspends Michael Vick indefinitely without pay for dogfighting ring involvement.
Vick to appear in court Monday, where he will plead guilty to federal charges.
He admitted to participating in dogfighting and killing dogs that did not fight well.
Vick faces up to five years in prison and a $250,000 fine.
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70:
Youssif, a 5-year-old Iraqi boy, was severely burned by masked men in January.
His parents tried to get help in Baghdad but were met with little success.
The Children's Burn Foundation will cover all medical costs for Youssif's treatment.
Youssif and his family will travel to the US for treatment and a new start.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264:
Iraqi women turn to prostitution due to poverty and desperation to feed their families.
Suha and Karima, two mothers, share their stories of being forced into sex work.
Violence, lack of government aid, and increased cost of living drive women to this path.
Humanitarian workers and activists aim to help these victims and bring attention to the issue.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d:
Colombian military killed key FARC rebel commander Tomas Medina Caracas in an air attack over the weekend.

Medina Caracas was a fugitive from a U.S. drug trafficking indictment and managed FARC's cocaine trafficking network.

He was charged with conspiracy to import cocaine into the United States and manufacturing cocaine within Colombia.

14 dead rebels were found at the FARC camp, along with rifles, communications equipment, and GPS systems.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048:
Tony Snow to step down as White House press secretary on September 14.
Dana Perino to replace Snow as deputy press secretary takes over.
President Bush praises Snow's service and wishes him well in cancer battle.
Snow leaves for more money, citing loan paid off by family.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156:
An empty rocket launcher tube was found on a Jersey City home's front lawn on Friday morning.
The launcher, an AT4 anti-tank device, was turned over to U.S. Army officials for disposal.
The Joint Terrorism Task Force is investigating the origin of the launcher and its appearance on residential property.
The launcher is no longer operable and not considered a hazard to public safety.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
President Bush to argue against Iraq withdrawal by invoking historical lessons of Vietnam.
Withdrawal from Vietnam led to suffering of millions of innocent citizens, Bush will say.
Bush to argue that withdrawing from Vietnam emboldened today's terrorists by compromising U.S. credibility.
President Bush to invoke historical comparisons from Asia to support his stance on Iraq.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf:
Police defuse a bomb in Haymarket, central London, on June 29, 2007.
Four men attempt to carry out a second wave of attacks on July 21, 2005.
Four suicide bombers detonate themselves on July 7, 2005, killing 52 people.
Al Qaeda claims responsibility for the July 7, 2005, bombings.
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7:
Carlos Alberto joins Werder Bremen for 7.8 million euros, a club record fee.
He previously played for FC Porto, winning the Champions League in 2004.
Carlos Alberto aims to win titles with Werder Bremen, his new club.
He has played for several Brazilian clubs, including Fluminense and Corinthians.
35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242:
Vice President Dick Cheney will serve as acting president on Saturday.
President Bush is undergoing a routine colonoscopy at Camp David, Maryland.
The procedure is expected to take about 2 1/2 hours and is supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb.
Bush's doctor recommended the procedure in about five years due to previous results.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605:
A magnitude 4.2 earthquake shook the San Francisco area at 4:42 a.m. PT on Friday.
The quake left about 2,000 customers without power in the area.
The USGS classified the quake as "light," causing minimal damage.
The shaking lasted about 50 seconds and was felt indoors.
0d43b97000ff852282c89d8d105e41495c0ee9bd:
Six men trapped in a Utah coal mine for almost a month are unlikely to be found alive.
Rescue efforts have exhausted all options, with no signs of life detected.
The mine's collapse on August 6 trapped the men, and three rescuers have died in the process.
Families of the missing miners are deeply saddened by the failed rescue efforts.
bf0cd4ccacd4fe045995338f4c44d9cf18000226:
At least 14 people were killed in a bomb explosion in Batna, east of Algiers, on Thursday.

The explosion occurred 20 meters from a mosque, 15 minutes before President Abdel-Aziz Bouteflika's expected arrival.

A suspect person attempted to breach security but escaped after the bomb exploded.

President Bouteflika visited the wounded at a hospital before returning to the capital.
2f43e9dfaa43ffbddbce339a8b6403ddce43b38a:
David Beckham signs 5-year contract with Los Angeles Galaxy team in Major League Soccer.

Beckham's journey from east London to Hollywood Hills is a story of incredible rise to football stardom.

Beckham's skills have graced the greatest stages in world soccer, including Manchester United and England.

Beckham and his family will adapt to life in Los Angeles, navigating celebrity endorsement and Tinseltown's glitterati.
eb68bc51ed4fc727a1af058192a3fef0916c91e7:
Virus found in healthy Australian honey bees may be linked to US colony collapse disorder.
Israeli Acute Paralysis Virus (IAPV) identified in US bees with colony collapse disorder.
Australian bees resistant to IAPV, but US bees are not.
Researchers to study IAPV's role in colony collapse disorder.
ad021a7924ee57491cee8576499ac196b1afeb23:
Savers line up to withdraw cash from Northern Rock branches in the UK.
Customers have withdrawn about £1 billion since the bank's woes were revealed.
Shares in Northern Rock dropped up to 30 percent in Friday trading.
The Bank of England bailed out Northern Rock to create a stable banking system.
